newsitem.title: JAPAN: JR Tokai to offer discount tickets to shareholders.
newsitem.headline: JR Tokai to offer discount tickets to shareholders.

text.p: Central Japan Railway Co (JR Tokai) said on Friday that it would give shareholders 10-percent discount tickets on its train fees.
JR Tokai, one of the seven companies which arose from the splitting up of the state-run Japanese National Railways (JNR) in 1987, is expected to be listed before the end of this year.
To receive the discount tickets, shareholders of JR Tokai must be registered as of the end of March every year.
JR Tokai said that shareholders of up to 10 shares in the company will receive one discount ticket per share.
It also said that shareholders of 1,000 shares or more will receive 500 tickets.
Another firm, East Japan Railway Co, has offered its shareholders 20-percent discount tickets. The company listed its shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange's first section in October 1993.
